section.title: Uninstalling &abbrev;
section.para: If you need to uninstall &abbrev; for some reason, you have the following options:

listitem.para: If you have installed &abbrev; using the .run installer: Execute the uninstall.sh script located at /opt/syslog-ng/bin/uninstall.sh. The uninstall script will automatically restore the syslog daemon used before installing syslog-ng. To completely remove &abbrev;, including the configuration files, use the uninstall.sh --purge command.

If you have installed &abbrev; from a .deb package: Execute the dpkg -r syslog-ng-premium-edition command to remove syslog-ng, or the dpkg -P syslog-ng-premium-edition command to remove &abbrev; and the configuration files as well. Note that removing &abbrev; does not restore the syslog daemon used before syslog-ng.

If you have installed &abbrev; from an .rpm package: Execute the rpm -e syslog-ng-premium-edition command to remove &abbrev;. Note that removing &abbrev; does not restore the syslog daemon used before &abbrev;.
If you have installed &abbrev; from a .pkg package: Execute the pkgrm BBsyslng command to remove &abbrev;. Note that removing &abbrev; does not restore the syslog daemon used before syslog-ng.
For automatic uninstall (answering y to all questions): Execute the yes | pkgrm BBsyslng command.
The following files have to be deleted manually:
anything else under the <syslog-ng path>/var directory
